item.title: LabRat - Autonomous search and rescue robot
item.description: One of the classes that I took while earning my Master’s Degree at CMU wasHardware for Software Engineers instructed by Professor Anthony Lattanze. Not only was the class well taught, but the final project was a blast. The LabRat is an autonomous robot designed by John Peabody Jr and Krishna Ersson to complete a search-and-rescue challenge. On a 4′ x 6′ game board, the LabRat was designed and programmed to autonomously locate pylons, randomly placed, and return the pylons to the home square.
